title: Sheet Pan Roasted Chicken Thighs with Brussels Sprouts Recipe
description: This sheet pan dinner features chicken thighs, sausage, and Brussels sprouts coated and roasted in a seasoned, herbaceous mixture for a no-fuss meal.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Everyday Cooking Sheet Pan Dinner Recipes Sheet Pan Roasted Chicken Thighs with Brussels Sprouts 4.8 (20) 19 Reviews 4 Photos This is an easy sheet pan dinner of roasted chicken thighs with Brussels sprouts that's full of flavor and can be easily customized to your tastes. The secret is roasting at a high temperature, allowing the water to steam out, leaving all that concentrated, yummy flavor. Submitted by Jewelzee Updated on December 5, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 4 4 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 25 mins Additional Time: 35 mins Total Time: 1 hr 20 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 4 (5 ounce) skin-on, bone-in chicken thighs 1 pound Brussels sprouts, halved ½ cup dry white wine 1 (3.5 ounce) link Italian sausage, sliced 3 large shallots, sliced 1 medium lemon, thinly sliced 4 cloves garlic, sliced 2 tablespoons olive oil, or as needed 1 teaspoon chopped fresh rosemary, or to taste 1 teaspoon fennel seeds, or to taste 1 teaspoon chopped fresh thyme, or to taste 1 teaspoon chopped fresh sage, or to taste sea salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste nonstick cooking spray Directions Clean and trim fat from chicken. Pat dry with paper towels. Place in a large bowl with Brussels sprouts, wine, sausage, shallots, lemon slices, garlic, oil, rosemary, fennel seeds, thyme, sage, sea salt, and pepper. Toss together with your hands and allow to marinate at room temperature, tossing occasionally, for at least 30 minutes. Preheat the oven to 475 degrees F (245 degrees C). Spray a baking pan with nonstick spray. Pour chicken-vegetable mixture onto the prepared baking pan. Arrange thighs, skin-side up, over mixture. Roast in the preheated oven until thighs are browned, crispy, and no longer pink in the centers, 25 to 30 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted near the bone should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Let rest for 5 to 10 minutes before serving. Add Your Photo Photos of Sheet Pan Roasted Chicken Thighs with Brussels Sprouts 01 of 04 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 04 Photo by  amandac 02/19/2024 Loved it! I got skinless too. Didn’t realize it. But still very tasty! 03 of 04 Photo by  Tish 03/12/2021 Delicious recipe. The herbs used made the whole house smell like a pizza joint! I added some multi-colored carrots to the mix for extra veg. Also had to cook the chicken for 10-15 mins longer than the recipe to ensure chicken was properly cooked through. Skin was deliciously crispy, too. 1 You’ll Also Love Sheet Pan Chicken and Veggies with Mustard Vinaigrette 11 Ratings Chicken, Apple, and Brussels Sprout Sheet Pan Dinner 31 Ratings Maple-Roasted Chicken Thighs 36 Ratings Make-Ahead Sausage and Veggie Bowls 1 Rating Easy, Meaty Sheet Pan Meal 8 Ratings Sheet Pan Lemon Garlic Chicken with Vegetables 1 Rating Lemon Garlic Shrimp with Roasted Brussels Sprouts and Brown Rice Roasted Brussels Sprouts and Kielbasa 89 Ratings Fall Quinoa Salad with Poppy Seed Dressing 2 Ratings Pan-Roasted Chicken with Lemon-Garlic Brussels Sprouts and Potatoes 110 Ratings Autumn Rainbow Sheet Pan Dinner 29 Ratings Sheet Pan Chicken Breast with Feta and Vegetables 10 Ratings Keto Smoky Chicken and Vegetable Sheet Pan Dinner 26 Ratings Moroccan Chicken Thigh Sheet Pan Dinner 15 Ratings Vegan Green Bean, Tomato, and Basil Sheet Pan Dinner 22 Ratings Sheet Pan Blackened Chicken Strips Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Jewelzee
instructions: Clean and trim fat from chicken. Pat dry with paper towels. Place in a large bowl with Brussels sprouts, wine, sausage, shallots, lemon slices, garlic, oil, rosemary, fennel seeds, thyme, sage, sea salt, and pepper. Toss together with your hands and allow to marinate at room temperature, tossing occasionally, for at least 30 minutes.;Preheat the oven to 475 degrees F (245 degrees C). Spray a baking pan with nonstick spray.;Pour chicken-vegetable mixture onto the prepared baking pan. Arrange thighs, skin-side up, over mixture.;Roast in the preheated oven until thighs are browned, crispy, and no longer pink in the centers, 25 to 30 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted near the bone should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Let rest for 5 to 10 minutes before serving.
